title: Support from Türk Kızılay to Algeria for the Forest Fires
shortDescription: Türk Kızılay dispatched aid supplies to Algeria by military plane upon the request of the Algerian Red Crescent after the forest fires that broke out in various cities, especially Et-Tarif, in August and caused the death of 44 people.
content:
Türk Kızılay dispatched aid supplies to Algeria by military plane upon the request of the Algerian Red Crescent after the forest fires that broke out in various cities, especially Et-Tarif, in August and caused the death of 44 people.
On one hand, Türk Kızılay has been supporting the healing of the wounds after the flood disaster in Pakistan that caused one-third of the country to be under water. On the other hand, it carries out humanitarian aid activities in coordination with the Presidency of the Republic of Türkiye, Turkish Ministry of National Defense and Turkish Ministry of Foreign Affairs for the forest fires that started in Et-Tarif and various cities in Algeria in August, lasting for days and ending the lives of 44 people. It was emphasized that the extinguishing works continued by air and land, and it was stated that the treatment of many wounded continued in hospitals. It was announced that the majority of those who lost their lives were those who went on holiday to the region. It was stated that the fires caused great damage to forest areas, zoo and Al-Kala National Park in Et-Tarif province.
The Response of Türk Kızılay to Algeria’s Request for Assistance was Not Delayed

title: Kindness Journey Began from Türkiye to Pakistan
shortDescription: Under the coordination of the Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency of Türkiye (AFAD), the first Kindness Train carrying basic humanitarian aid materials prepared with the support of NGOs, including Türk Kızılay, set off with a ceremony held at the Historical Ankara Train Station for Pakistani flood victims.
content:
Under the coordination of the Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency of Türkiye (AFAD), the first Kindness Train carrying basic humanitarian aid materials prepared with the support of NGOs, including Türk Kızılay, set off with a ceremony held at the Historical Ankara Train Station for Pakistani flood victims.
Türk Kızılay became one of the first humanitarian organizations to deliver shelter, food and hygiene aids to disaster areas in Pakistan by taking action for the people which have been struggling with the flood disaster caused by monsoon rains for a few days. Determining the urgent needs in the region in cooperation with the Pakistani Red Crescent, Türk Kızılay sent tents, food parcels, hygiene kits, blankets, sponge mattresses, raincoats, boots, jerrycans and mosquito nets to Pakistani people via cargo planes and trucks.
The first of the KindnessTrains, which was previously sent for the needy in Afghanistan, set out for Pakistanis this time. The delivery of 100 tents, 1,000 blankets and 38,510 pieces of clothing, prepared under the coordination of AFAD and the transportation of Turkish State Railways, with the support of NGOs, including Türk Kızılay, set out to heal the wounds of the people in the region with a ceremony held at the Historical Ankara Train Station.

title: Kızılay ve Kanser Savaşçıları Derneği Kanser Hastaları İçin Örnek Bir Kampanyayı Hayata Geçiriyor
shortDescription: Türk Kızılay, Kanser Savaşçıları Derneği ile iş birliği yaparak “Damardan Kahramanım Olur Musun?” sloganıyla başlatılan kan bağışı kampanyasının lansmanını İstanbul/Çapa’da bulunan Kan Bağışı Merkezi’nde gerçekleştirdi..
content:
Türkiye’de her yıl kullanılan yaklaşık 3 milyon ünite kanın bir kısmı ameliyat, travma ve afet gibi acil durumlara ayrılırken, büyük bir kısmı ise başta kan kanseri olmak üzere diğer kanser türleri ve talasemi, anemi gibi düzenli kan nakli sağlanması gereken hematolojik hastalıkların tedavisi için kullanılıyor. Ramazan ve yaz aylarında azalma eğiliminde olan kan bağışları oranı, 2 yılı aşkın süredir devam eden COVID-19 pandemisinin de eklenmesiyle %14 azalmış durumda.
Kızılay ve Kanser Savaşçıları Derneği ise bu duruma dikkat çekmek ve vatandaşlarda farkındalık oluşturarak kan bağışı oranlarını arttırmak amacıyla İstanbul/Çapa’da bulunan Kızılay Kan Bağışı Merkezi’nde “Damardan Kahramanım Olur Musun?” sloganıyla başlatılan kan bağışı kampanyasının basın toplantısını yaptı.
“Günlük 9 bin civarında kan bağışı aldığımızda hedefimize ulaşıyoruz”

title: Ömrünü Adadığı Yetimler Kızılay Şehidi Kıdıman’ı Andı
shortDescription: İhtiyaç sahiplerine yardım ulaştırırken 2020 yılında Suriye’de hain bir saldırıda şehit olan Kızılay çalışanı Mehmet Arif Kıdıman, görev arkadaşları ve sorumluluk alanındaki yetimler tarafından şehadetinin yıl dönümünde anıldı. Şehidin adına açılan okulda öğrenim gören öğrencilere kırtasiye desteğinin yanı sıra farklı bölgelerde mevlidler okutuldu.
content:
İhtiyaç sahiplerine yardım ulaştırırken 2020 yılında Suriye’de hain bir saldırıda şehit olan Kızılay çalışanı Mehmet Arif Kıdıman, görev arkadaşları ve sorumluluk alanındaki yetimler tarafından şehadetinin yıl dönümünde anıldı. Şehidin adına açılan okulda öğrenim gören öğrencilere kırtasiye desteğinin yanı sıra farklı bölgelerde mevlidler okutuldu.
Kızılay şehidi Mehmet Arif Kıdıman, şehadetinin yıl dönümünde çalışma arkadaşları ve görev alanı içinde olan İdlib, Cerablus, Azez, El Bab, Resulayn ve Tel Abyad bölgelerindeki Kızılay yetimhanelerindeki çocuklar tarafından anıldı. Yetimlere ve öğrencilere kırtasiye setleri, oyuncaklar ve hediyeler dağıtılırken, Şehit Kıdıman için camilerde Hatm-i Şerif ve Mevlid-i Şerifler de okutan Kızılaycılar, lokma döktürerek dağıttı.
Kızılay Şehidi Mehmet Arif Kıdıman
Suriye'nin El Bab bölgesinde yardım faaliyetlerinde görevli olan Şehit Mehmet Arif Kıdıman, Çobanbey-El Bab arasında seyir halindeki üzerinde ve tavanında belirgin bir şekilde Kızılay amblemi bulunan Türk Kızılay aracına, plakasız iki araç içerisinden yüzleri maskeli ve kamuflaj kıyafetli kişiler tarafından açılan çapraz ateş sonucu 14 Eylül 2020 tarihinde şehit oldu.

title: Türk Kızılay Delivered Aid to Flood Victims in Chad and Sudan
shortDescription: Türk Kızılay distributed 500 food and 500 supplies parcels to those affected by the floods caused by heavy rains in Chad this year. On the other hand, Türk Kızılay, in cooperation with the Sudanese Red Crescent, delivered 500 food parcels to those affected by the flood in Dungula province of Sudan.
content:
Türk Kızılay distributed 500 food and 500 supplies parcels to those affected by the floods caused by heavy rains in Chad this year. On the other hand, Türk Kızılay, in cooperation with the Sudanese Red Crescent, delivered 500 food parcels to those affected by the flood in Dungula province of Sudan.
Türk Kızılay continues to be a ray of hope for humanity through the delegations it has established in countries affected by natural disasters and protracted crisis. Identifying those affected by the floods that have continued since July in Encemine, the capital of Chad, Türk Kızılay distributed 500 food and 500 supplies parcels at the delivery ceremony. Türkiye's Encemine Ambassador Kemal Kaygısız, Encemine 2nd Region Mayor Yusuf Mahamat Yaro, Head of Türk Kızılay’s Chad Delegation Firas Kankan and the President of the Red Cross of Chad Khala Ahmat Senoussi attended the delivery ceremony of the food packages.

title: Cooperation between 3CX's Platinum Business Partner Bilişim Bilgisayar and Türk Kızılay
shortDescription: Aiming to ensure uninterrupted communication between its approximately 12 thousand employees and its internal stakeholders, Türk Kızılay has signed a protocol with 3CX's Platinum Business Partner Bilişim Bilgisayar with the sponsorship of 3CX, developer of the award-winning business communications solution. Within the scope of the cooperation, it is aimed to use the softphone system within the organization.
content:
Aiming to ensure uninterrupted communication between its approximately 12 thousand employees and its internal stakeholders, Türk Kızılay has signed a protocol with 3CX's Platinum Business Partner Bilişim Bilgisayar with the sponsorship of 3CX, developer of the award-winning business communications solution. Within the scope of the cooperation, it is aimed to use the softphone system within the organization.
Due to the limitations of its old PBXs, Türk Kızılay, as a part of the largest humanitarian aid network that carries out various activities on a national and global scale with its personnel network and workforce spread across Turkey and the world, switched to the Windows-based 3CX IP phone system in order to establish a seamless communication between its approximately 12 thousand employees and internal stakeholders.

title: Dr. Kinik: “World's Attention To Pakistan Is Not Enough”
shortDescription: Examining the humanitarian aid carried out in flood-hit Pakistan, the President of Türk Kızılay Dr. Kerem Kinik said that the disaster in Pakistan was huge and the world's sensitivity to this great disaster was insufficient.
content:
Examining the humanitarian aid carried out in flood-hit Pakistan, the President of Türk Kızılay Dr. Kerem Kinik said that the disaster in Pakistan was huge and the world's sensitivity to this great disaster was insufficient.
In the last week of August, the water level of the Kabul River, which passed through the city of Nowshera, rose as a result of heavy rains, causing one-third of Pakistan to be flooded and life to a standstill. After the first minutes of the disaster, Türk Kızılay got in contact with the Pakistani Red Crescent Society through its delegation and identified the needs. In order to heal the wounds of the flood disaster, which affected nearly 40 million people, it has delivered 100 tons of humanitarian aid supplies by rail and 25 tons by land to Balochistan, which was most affected by the flood.
